messages.content: I am proud to stand for Labour in Eastleigh on a platform which is for the many, not the few. Theresa May talks about supporting the ordinary working class, but her actions tell another story - it is the rich that benefit under the Conservatives. Labour now has a leader who will deliver a radical alternative; ending the policies of failed austerity and the dogma of privatisation supported by both the Tories and the LibDems. We will work to rebuild our welfare state and reduce the inequalities that are becoming ever more apparent. Through investment in our economy we can build an efficient, sustainable, environmentally friendly way forward for everyone and a society we are proud of. Jill Payne

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Labour is proud of the NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: We will protect and integrate social care. Staff & services are under pressure that they don’t deserve.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Labour will scrap Tories’ Brexit plan
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Putting economy first in negotiations. May’s focus is on immigration, Labour’s will be the economy.
Keep money flowing through the banks; Labour will invest in manufacture through a National Investment Bank.
Everyone must have a guaranteed home with no need to relive the fear and stress of another crisis.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A national education service, open to all
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The progressive restoration of free higher education and reversal of tuition fees, apprenticeships and adult skills training.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour will scrap Tories’ Brexit plan, putting economy first in negotiations. May’s focus is on immigration, Labour’s will be the economy.
issues.economy: The economy is key, but the Tories have no plan. Tax cuts for those at the top, failed austerity for the rest of us. We will invest in our economy; democratically controlled to deliver wealth for all communities in a genuinely mixed economy. Tory promises have proven to be worthless.
issues.education: A national education service, open to all. The progressive restoration of free higher education and reversal of tuition fees, apprenticeships and adult skills training.
issues.environment: The environment matters - the Tories don't care. Anyone visiting the local waste recycling centre will have noticed a reduction in queues since charges were introduced. Fly tipping is increasing. This is a false economy and another example of the Tories' approach to public services.
issues.health: Labour is proud of the NHS. We will protect and integrate social care. Staff & services are under pressure they don't deserve. NHS & Social Care - the Tories don't care. Human misery aside, it's economic sense to integrate social care into the NHS to stop bed-blocking, meaning cancelled ops, patients on trolleys in corridors & ambulances unable to deliver patients & attend the next emergency call out. The Tory approach is cynical & inefficient.

community.content: We will work to rebuild our welfare state and reduce the inequalities that are becoming ever more apparent. Through investment in our economy we can build an efficient, sustainable, environmentally friendly way forward for everyone and a society we are proud of.

contactInformation.address: Eastleigh Labour Party, 69 Leigh Rd, Eastleigh SO50 9DF

endorsements.endorsement: Jill is passionate about supporting people - close to home as a union rep, further afield those not as lucky as us, escaping war and oppression. Jill would be a great working class representative in a constituency that lacks a working class voice. And will fight for a future for the younger generation, with policies that are about people, not profit.

examples: Labour is proud of the NHS. We will protect and integrate social care. Staff & services are under pressure they don't deserve.
Labour will scrap Tories’ Brexit plan. Putting economy first in negotiations. May’s focus is on immigration, Labour’s will be the economy.
We need an industrial plan. Keep money flowing through the banks; Labour will invest in manufacture through a National Investment Bank.
Secure homes for all. Everyone must have a guaranteed home with no need to relive the fear and stress of another crisis.
A national education service, open to all. The progressive restoration of free higher education and reversal of tuition fees, apprenticeships and adult skills training.

The environment matters - the Tories don't care. Anyone visiting the local waste recycling centre will have noticed a reduction in queues since charges were introduced. Fly tipping is increasing. This is a false economy and another example of the Tories' approach to public services.

The environment matters - the Tories don't care. Anyone visiting the local waste recycling centre will have noticed a reduction in queues since charges were introduced. Fly tipping is increasing. This is a false economy and another example of the Tories' approach to public services.
Labour is proud of the NHS. We will protect and integrate social care. Staff & services are under pressure they don't deserve.
Labour will scrap Tories’ Brexit plan. Putting economy first in negotiations. May’s focus is on immigration, Labour’s will be the economy.
We need an industrial plan. Keep money flowing through the banks; Labour will invest in manufacture through a National Investment Bank.
Secure homes for all. Everyone must have a guaranteed home with no need to relive the fear and stress of another crisis.
A national education service, open to all. The progressive restoration of free higher education and reversal of tuition fees, apprenticeships and adult skills training.

The economy is key, but the Tories have no plan. Tax cuts for those at the top, failed austerity for the rest of us. We will invest in our economy; democratically controlled to deliver wealth for all communities in a genuinely mixed economy. Tory promises have proven to be worthless.

NHS & Social Care - the Tories don't care. Human misery aside, it's economic sense to integrate social care into the NHS to stop bed-blocking, meaning cancelled ops, patients on trolleys in corridors & ambulances unable to deliver patients & attend the next emergency call out. The Tory approach is cynical & inefficient.

Terry Crow: Jill is passionate about supporting people - close to home as a union rep, further afield those not as lucky as us, escaping war and oppression. Jill would be a great working class representative in a constituency that lacks a working class voice. And will fight for a future for the younger generation, with policies that are about people, not profit.

The environment matters - the Tories don't care. Anyone visiting the local waste recycling centre will have noticed a reduction in queues since charges were introduced. Fly tipping is increasing. This is a false economy and another example of the Tories' approach to public services.

The economy is key, but the Tories have no plan. Tax cuts for those at the top, failed austerity for the rest of us. We will invest in our economy; democratically controlled to deliver wealth for all communities in a genuinely mixed economy. Tory promises have proven to be worthless.

NHS & Social Care - the Tories don't care. Human misery aside, it's economic sense to integrate social care into the NHS to stop bed-blocking, meaning cancelled ops, patients on trolleys in corridors & ambulances unable to deliver patients & attend the next emergency call out. The Tory approach is cynical & inefficient.
Through investment in our economy we can build an efficient, sustainable, environmentally friendly way forward for everyone and a society we are proud of.
Theresa May talks about supporting the ordinary working class, but her actions tell another story - it is the rich that benefit under the Conservatives.
